N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9 ยง 7903.2 - Issuance of assignment orders

State Regulations
(a) Upon determining that an application for
assignment should be granted pursuant to Part 7901 of this subchapter, the

State Energy Office shall issue an assignment order in writing, naming the
applicant, the prime supplier required to supply product, and any wholesale
purchaser-reseller required to supply the applicant on behalf of the prime
supplier; specifying the type and volume of fuel assigned, the location to be
supplied, and any particular purpose for which the assigned fuel is to be used; and if necessary authorizing cross-brand sales notwithstanding the general
provisions of General Business Law, Section 391-a. (b) The order shall include a brief statement
summarizing the basis upon which the order is issued. The order shall provide
that any person aggrieved thereby may file an appeal with the State Energy

Office in accordance with Part 7904 of this subchapter. (c) The order shall state that it is
effective upon issuance and shall expire within 10 days of its issuance unless
the applicant presents his copy of the order to the prime supplier or any
wholesale purchaser-reseller required to supply the applicant on behalf of the
prime supplier within those 10 days. (d) The State Energy Office shall serve a
copy of the order by mail upon the applicant, the designated State
representative of the prime supplier assigned to the applicant, and any
wholesale purchaser-reseller required to supply the applicant on behalf of the
prime supplier. Notes
